conversation.content: So I'm probably overreacting but like, my internet keeps cutting out? Sorry, I know you're busy.

Oh no no, please don't apologize! Let me pull up your account here... hmm, I see you're on our fiber plan at 4827 Maple Drive, and wow, I'm actually seeing some concerning patterns in your connection logs from the past 72 hours.
Wait, patterns? Like what kind of... I mean, is it bad?

So it's dropping, uh, about every 40 minutes which is—yeah that's really frustrating, I can imagine trying to work with that. Your modem ID shows XFR-9982-MK and it's actually reconnecting fine each time, but then just... let me check the node status real quick.
I think maybe it's my fault? I moved the router last week, so...

Oh honestly? Moving it shouldn't cause this kind of issue at all. What I'm seeing here is, er, your local node NDX-47B is showing intermittent signal degradation, which means—well basically it's on our end, not yours, so please don't feel bad about calling!
But what if—God, I have a presentation tomorrow and if it drops—

Okay I completely understand that panic. Here's what we can do right now, um... I'm scheduling a priority tech visit for slot T-8AM-921, that's first thing tomorrow morning, and meanwhile let me see if I can... actually, hold on, trying something from my end.
Tomorrow? That's—wait no, the presentation's at nine! This is—I can't—

I hear you, I really do. Alright, let me... hmm, if I boost your signal strength to level 8 temporarily and reroute you through node NDX-45A instead, that should—yeah, that might just hold you through tomorrow.
You can do that? Like right now? Sorry, I don't understand the technical—
Absolutely can! So I'm making these changes now, takes about, oh, 3 minutes to propagate through the system, and your new routing code is RT-KLMN-2847 if the tech asks tomorrow.
I just—thank you. Really. I feel stupid for panicking.

Please don't! I'd be stressed too—actually last month my internet died during my kid's virtual parent-teacher conference, so, er, I get it. The temporary fix should hold, but that tech tomorrow will replace your line tap, part number LTP-3392-X, permanently.
Okay so basically just... wait? Will I know if it worked?

Yeah exactly, and, uh, you should see your modem lights cycle in about—actually probably happening right now—then stay solid green. Your connection ID after this reconfig will be CNXF-8829-TMP, which the tech needs.
They're—yeah they're blinking! Green now! Oh thank God.
Perfect! Really glad that worked. Now if it drops again tonight, which—fingers crossed it won't—but if it does, call back with reference number REF-92847-EM and they'll escalate immediately.
I'm sorry I got so worked up, you've been so patient.
Aw no, you were totally fine! Honestly some days I talk to, mmm, way angrier people about way smaller issues. Good luck with that presentation tomorrow—you're gonna do great!
